I still have faith. We can be worthy of the promise laid out in our Constitution.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
We can‚Äôt allow it. Through the January 6 Commission and the Justice Department, we must hold accountable those responsible - including those at the top. 

And we must pass the Freedom to Vote Act, fulfilling the promise of our nation, giving the people the power to decide.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
The insurrection failed, but the fight continues nationwide.

The plan is clear. Step 1) Make it harder to vote. Step 2) Give partisans the power to overturn the people‚Äôs votes.

This strategy is connected to January 6 and the path to overturning democracy if we allow it.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
There‚Äôs no getting around what happened. On January 6, there was a violent attack on the United States, led by insurrectionists whose goal was to overthrow the free and fair election of President Biden. 

This happened because Donald Trump incited them to violence.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: I‚Äôve thought a lot about this day over the past year. It‚Äôs important we are clear about what happened, how it connects to what has happened since, and what needs to happen next.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
On January 6, I woke up early. 

I wrote down a few thoughts and then my husband Archie popped the anxious question, ‚ÄúAre you going to be ok?‚Äù 

For sure I told him‚Äîthe United States Capitol is one of the safest places in the country. Little did I know.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
We need rules of course. But reasonable ones that allow us to get things done. If the rules are allowing the minority to stop anything, maybe it's time to change the rules.

Let's end the filibuster.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
And that's exactly what the GOP is doing. There's no way to defend sending the US into financial default. It makes no sense, unless you care more about getting on Fox News instead of being responsible.

So the GOP weaponizes rules and hides behind how confusing they are instead.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Let's say you hold a position that is impossible to justify.

Ridiculous Senate rules give you a way out! Instead of arguing your point, you can hide behind fancy sounding procedures like the filibuster to obscure your real position.

See? Doublespeak.

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Republicans stole two Supreme Court seats and as demonstrated by this decision, much of the current Court is dangerously unmoored from any reasonable principles of legal analysis.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: And if we do that successfully, and we get a few more seats, we should use our power to eliminate the filibuster and expand the court.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Expanding our majorities in Congress will be hard. There‚Äôs a good chance we could lose one or both Houses in 2022. But remember that a strong majority of the public agrees with us on reproductive rights. It‚Äôs a voting issue and a winning one. So it‚Äôs our job to make the case.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: The reality is that if a vote was brought up tomorrow to change or eliminate the filibuster or reform or add seats to the Supreme Court, it would fail. I wish it were different. We don‚Äôt have the numbers and that‚Äôs what we have to focus on changing.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: So we‚Äôre going to fight. But I want to be clear that there is not a magical lever of power we could pull but are avoiding. We can tweet and send out press releases stating our positions as much as we like, but that‚Äôs not a strategy.

name: Senator Tina Smith

Look, I'm not just a Senator. I'm also a grandmother, and our generation owes future generations a planet that's safe to live on.
 
This summer, Congress must get behind a clean electricity standard and pass it into law. I'm going to keep working to make sure we do.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
The key is important groups have supported clean electricity standards.

Utility companies like how they lowers costs (clean energy is not just clean‚Äîit's cheap); labor unions like the jobs created; and environmental groups want to combat climate change with bold legislation.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
It‚Äôs simple: we set a goal to get to 100% clean electricity (net zero carbon pollution) as soon as possible. And then we help power generators - from the big utilities to your local coop - make the shift to clean power.
 
Sounds great! But can it pass?
 
It can! Here's why:

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Most Americans already support what we need to do‚Äîmove to a clean energy future‚Äîand fast.
 
The best, most effective way to do this is to invest in a clean electricity standard. How does that work?

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Climate change isn't some pie-in-the-sky problem we can deal with later; it's happening right now.
 
So I've been working on a way we can take real action to combat climate change. I'm confident it can pass the Senate and it‚Äôs in the budget deal. I want to tell you about it.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: So this week, as we consider what has changed and what has not, I am focused on the work we need to do to reimagine public safety, and all the systems that steal opportunity and deny the value of Black lives.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Systems built up over 400 years to devalue Black lives will not change easily. Entrenched power fights change as it always has.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Millions of people took to the streets, refusing to accept the daily trauma of white police officers shooting unarmed Black people. They marched for justice and an end to the systemic racism that creates inequity in housing, the environment, health care, and wealth.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Since George Floyd's murder one year ago today, we‚Äôve taken steps toward justice. Important steps for sure, but too few.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
I'll have more to say soon but I want folks to know that even in the midst of this health crisis, I believe there's hope on the horizon for those who struggle with mental illness. But we in the Senate have to do the work to help make that vision a reality. 

Time to get to work.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
I'm announcing I'm rolling out three bills this month addressing the mental health crisis in America. The theme that unites them all: access to resources. 

When I struggled with depression, resources were there for me. Many Americans don't get those, let's change that.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
I'm grateful I got help, but I share this because I want anyone suffering from a mental health issue to know they are not alone. We can all help break the stigma around talking about this.

But also as a Senator, I recognize my unique position. And I want to use it.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Did I live happily ever after? Not quite. Mental illness isn't a box where you're healthy or not‚Äîit's a spectrum. 

I struggled again in my 30s as a young mom. But after a few years of treatment, I improved and know I can turn to it if I need it again.

Happier IS possible.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
When my roommate first talked to me about how I hadn't been myself, I was in denial. But eventually, I realized it made sense to go see a counselor. I didn't know what to expect and honestly, I was embarrassed. 

But the experience changed my life.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
When it started in college, I thought it was just a rough patch. But at some point, it got harder to cope with life's daily challenges. 

Everybody who's wrestled with depression has their metaphor, but many can identify with the sensation of color draining out of the world.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
I want to share something personal for Mental Health Awareness month. We need more understanding and help for the millions of Americans who struggle with mental illness.

I'm not saying that just because I'm a Senator, I'm saying that as someone who has suffered from depression.

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Tonight, I'm looking forward to hearing @POTUS talk more about his plans in the #AmericanFamiliesPlan, and I am so glad that childcare and early education are getting the top-billing these issues deserve.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: But there is still much more to be done to make the big, structural investments we need to provide affordable, quality, care for kids and families.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: The bulk of that came from the #AmericanRescuePlan, where we worked together to get $39 billion to stabilize childcare after the hit it took with the pandemic.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: I've been proud to work with incredible partners in Congress @PattyMurray and @SenWarren to help deliver historic funding to help stabilize this essential sector with more than $50 billion.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: As parents know, childcare faced huge challenges before the pandemic. But with COVID it was pushed to the brink and in some cases over the edge. Hearing from childcare providers in Minnesota inspired me to tackle this issue head on.

On Earth Day in 2021,  It‚Äôs a little more complicated, but I‚Äôm still outraged.  Who is trashing our planet?

On the first Earth Day in 1970, 20 million Americans took to the streets, parks and classrooms to demonstrate against the impacts of air and water pollution. That was 10% of the US and would be 33 million people today.
 
Where is everyone ‚Äì let‚Äôs do it.

name: Senator Tina Smith

This is the work ahead of all of us.

name: Senator Tina Smith

And we can change them.

What if this verdict is the beginning of a transformation in public safety for Minnesota and our country, where we move past the warrior model of policing and toward a model of truly protecting and serving?

name: Senator Tina Smith

These inequities exist, not only in Minnesota, but all across our country.

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
No way to sugarcoat this.

Republicans are arguing their case before the nation's highest court to wipe away health care for millions in the middle of the greatest public health catastrophe in a century.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
So yes, if the Supreme Court strikes down the ACA, not only would millions lose their health care, but we'd again live in a country where huge companies could force ordinary Americans into bankruptcy to pay for drugs like insulin.
 
This is what is at stake in this case.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
So I got a law passed that helps make insulin affordable. It was a blow to the profits of big pharmaceutical companies but a win for everyone else.
 
Here's the problem: a bill like this requires the ACA's framework. If that goes, so does this bill.

name: Senator Tina Smith

I'll close by saying that this pandemic only exacerbated the childcare crisis. I've been working on this issue my entire time in the Senate‚Äîthe way we do childcare in this country needs an overhaul.

So let's make sure childcare survives this crisis AND fix the system long-term.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: This isn't just the right thing to do, it's also an investment. Working moms contribute a huge amount to our workforce, if communities lack childcare, we are risking hamstringing our economic recovery.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
With more emergency funding, we can avert this crisis. We can allow providers to keep staff on payroll, get PPE, and get assistance for other expenses needed to make childcare work.

Our bill has 50 billion in funding for this effect.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: I'll touch on number two in this thread. Mass closures are a serious issue. Childcare has always had thin margins and an early survey indicated nearly half of all providers could not survive a two week shutdown.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Our plan has three pieces.  

1) Providing support to providers caring for the children of those fighting this pandemic on the frontlines. 
2) Preventing mass permanent closures in the childcare system.
3) Shoring up the system to make it work better in the future.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
Also want to point out this crisis has been particularly hard on working moms. The @NYTimes had a feature on this recently, linked it here. 

So what can we do to ensure we have a robust childcare system in place when we can return to normal? https://t.co/2KwQvFKKuc

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith

name: Senator Tina Smith

My bill requires these guidelines be put in place.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: In the Senate cloakrooms we now have carefully labeled cubbies to put our phones, iPads and smart watches aside while we go onto the floor. You can tell it‚Äôs hard for some of us to leave them there.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Looking out at my colleagues, I was struck by how rare it is that we are all on the floor together, sitting down, and focused on one thing. What would the Senate be like if we came together like this more often?

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Senate staff on both sides of the aisle made sure we all lined up to sign the oath in the correct order. That was the only time all day that Democrats and Republicans mixed in together. We need to mix more.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: When Roberts came onto the floor the air changed. He looked, not pained, exactly, but as if he also felt the weight of history.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
After lunch, the women were thinking logistics. 

It‚Äôs freezing in the chamber, should I bring a shawl? One of my colleagues plans to wear long underwear. The stools under our desks are helpful - the chairs of the Senate were designed for the likes of Abe Lincoln.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text:
When the House managers came onto the floor, I felt the weight of history, and a small catch in my throat. 

It was a relief to hear @RepAdamSchiff present the articles dispassionately, clearly, and rationally. We are all wondering what the President‚Äôs lawyers will bring.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: From where I sit, close to the doors in the second row of seats, I can see the faces of most of my colleagues: serious, focused, aware that the country is watching.

name: Senator Tina Smith
tweet_text: Every day during the impeachment trial I‚Äôll be taking notes, which I‚Äôll share some of here.  Yesterday was day 1.
